data.text:
@hardcoreritafan @HopkinsNot @UKCovid19Stats Well, you’re not.

It’s an endemic virus. 

You still think it’s “new” so can’t possibly be endemic.

I’m still waiting for you to tell us how “old” a virus has to be to become endemic. 

It’ll be a long wait as you have no clue. At all.
@WSnobbig @HopkinsNot @UKCovid19Stats Oh yes, always you who is right, nobody else.
@hardcoreritafan @HopkinsNot @UKCovid19Stats I’m right. Let me know if you don’t understand.
@WSnobbig @HopkinsNot @UKCovid19Stats Bloody hell, I was expecting you to say you were joking by now but you're actually serious.
@WSnobbig @HopkinsNot @UKCovid19Stats "new coronavirus". What do you think 'novel coronavirus' means? https://t.co/m2pEXtSXkE

@eathummous1 @Pierredollar @postmanhat1 @UKCovid19Stats Some do!! RSV puts 1000s of elderly adults and children in hospital every year and kills too. 83 children and 5,000 to 10,000 adults die every year in the UK, for most people it is just a snotty cold....Sound familiar?
@WSnobbig @HopkinsNot @UKCovid19Stats Brilliant, a new strain so therefore a new virus. I take it reading comprehension isn't your best subject.

@hardcoreritafan @HopkinsNot @UKCovid19Stats SARS-COV-2. The clue is in the name. 

Let me know if you’ve missed it.
